ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned Portuguese and time management.

This second part of the program was a real turning point for me. Being in Brazil and living with my host family were both integral to a transformation in my conversational Portuguese, but this class really put me over the top. Going through exercises everyday and practicing with my classmates prepared me for day-to-day interactions with Cariocas.
This course was truly essential for my retainment of the Portuguese language.  I learned all about conjugation, sayings, sentence structure, and so much more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Ideal classroom size.
Weakness-homework posted too late in the day.

I really developed more confidence in this course. It helped me break the ice with speaking Portuguese conversationally. I felt all of my classmates loosen up more, which helped me do so as well. My only note would be that the last couple of weeks felt very grammar-heavy and conjugation-specific, and while I was able to stay afloat during this shift, I felt like it was very abrupt.
It goes by very fast. We had a bit of difficulty given the delays in travel from New Haven. But the course and material is well structured.

I can't think of any weaknesses other than sometimes it was difficult to understand a work or how to spell a word when it wasn't written down in front of us.  Strengths: an amazing professor who was more than happy to answer questions.  The materials we just were also super helpful and always available to us.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity.
Yes! I feel like my trip to Brazil was enriched by my participation in this course.
I loved being able to speak with native Brazilian-Portuguese speakers about grammar in the second level. It was very useful.

Yes, I would!  It was such an amazing experience learning Portuguese abroad and the manner in which you're learning is so much more practical.  This entire experience was amazing and I have no doubt my Portuguese would be nowhere near what it is without this course and it's structure.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will use Portuguese in my future career.

I already served as a bona fide translator on my family's trip around Brazil! I am really looking forward to reading some Portuguese literature, maybe first in translation and then in the target language. I also want to study linguistic interactions between the Iberian Peninsula and Northern Africa, and Portuguese will be an invaluable tool in that research. I hope Portuguese will continue to be essential in my day to day interactions.
I hope to continue learning Portuguese and speak fluently soon.

I hope to use Portuguese and all of the information Professor Jackson taught me in my career in Politics.  I hope to be able to facilitate more conversations and become a better communicator.  I also plan on continuing my Portuguese education.  Truly, what Professor Jackson has taught me will be appreciated for lifetimes to come.  Portuguese will now be added to the languages within my future household.
